bug.author: dylanfries
bug.summary: Attempting to debug with Monodevelop locks up both Monodevelop and Unity with 'Debugger operation failed'
bug.description: I'm not sure if this is the right place for this, but I've never seen this bug before using the ml-agents sample project. If I try to attach the debugger to the project, it fires up a ton of these 'Debugger operation failed' dialogues, then locks up both Monodevelop and Unity, requiring a forced reset. I'm on Windows 10 if that matters for anything. I've got this every time I've tried attaching in the project and I'm not sure if its expected behaviour, but its sure annoying. Otherwise, really enjoying the new tools, thanks! Dylan <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/103104/31299882-4834b4d4-aab6-11e7-880b-c4940bcaf898.PNG></denchmark-link>

comments.comment: Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/dylanfries>@dylanfries</denchmark-link> , Thanks for pointing this out. It may have something to do with our using the new .NET 4.6 framework, as it is still under experimental support. Was .NET 4.6 turned on by chance?
This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
